result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew T Searles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 97 days if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol or drugs.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

From defendant received 4/15/16 requesting to be eligible for CIP  and/or SAB programs.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew T Searles in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1: 
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years  - 97 days credit, Extended Supervision: 2 years) Stayed for 3 years Probation consecutive to present sentence. 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail consecutive
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Andrew T Searles in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.  Mary Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Broughton requests another date. Defense is waiting to hear from ADA Bayer. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on June 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Andrew T Searles in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Bryan C Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Attorney Broughton motioned for bail reduction and presents her argument to the court. State presents bail arguments to the court. Court denies motion to modify bail.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
